content.question: A curve is defined by the parametric equations <math alttext="x of t, equals, t squared, plus 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="y of t, equals, the sine of, open parenthesis, t squared, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following is an expression for <math alttext="the second derivative of y, with respect to x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>d</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mi>y</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>d</mi><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> in terms of <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="the negative of the sine of, open parenthesis, t squared, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="negative 2 t, times the sine of, open parenthesis, t squared, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>⁢</mo><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="the cosine of, open parenthesis, t squared, close parenthesis, minus 2 times t squared, times the sine of, open parenthesis, t squared, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="2 times the cosine of, open parenthesis, t squared, close parenthesis, minus 4 times t squared, times the sine of, open parenthesis, t squared, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mstyle><mrow><mi>cos</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the negative of the sine of, open parenthesis, t squared, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>sin</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><msup><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

unit.text: 9: Parametric Equations, Polar Coordinates, and Vector-Valued Functions

topic.text: 9.2: (BC ONLY) Second Derivatives of Parametric Equations

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
